page.title: 08A Bradley Farmer's Job.
page.content: The farmer's job is to make the fields grow crops,which he sells.In Bradley he grows wheat,beans and grass.In the winter he ploughs the fields and sows the seeds.In the spring and summer he looks after the plants,spraying with weedkiller and fertiliser,and cutting th grass.Autumn is harvest time.He combines the wheat and dries it in a big barn,he then sells it to be made into flour.The grass is grown for the cows to eat and their milk is sold.The grass is cut in the Spring for hay or silage to feed the cows in the winter when the grass is not growing.In winter the cows go into a barn where they have their own cubicles with a carpet on the floor and a trough for their food.A machine clears the muck away.The beans are harvested when they are dried and they are sold for cattle feed.
